question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Metropolitan France has historically been a target for terrorist activities, and large international events like the Summer Olympics typically attract increased security measures to mitigate such risks. The French government, in collaboration with international security agencies, usually implements comprehensive security protocols during the Olympics, including enhanced surveillance, intelligence gathering, and on-the-ground security presence. While these measures significantly reduce the likelihood of a successful terrorist attack, the inherent unpredictability of terrorist activities means that the risk cannot be entirely eliminated. Additionally, global geopolitical tensions and the evolving nature of terrorist tactics can influence the probability of such events occurring. Considering the heightened security efforts and historical context, the probability of a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics is low but not negligible.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Russian athletes have faced various bans and restrictions in international sporting events due to doping scandals and geopolitical tensions, including the invasion of Ukraine in 2022. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has previously allowed Russian athletes to compete under neutral or independent flags when appropriate. However, given the heightened international scrutiny and ongoing sanctions against Russia, it is likely that the IOC and other relevant authorities would choose to bar Russian athletes from competing in the 2024 Paris Olympics to uphold the integrity of the Games and respond to geopolitical pressures. Additionally, the threshold set for this question is stringent, allowing no more than 34 Russian athletes, which further supports the likelihood of a ban.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under any flag or as independent or neutral athletes. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded with certain athletes being barred from participation. If no athletes are barred from competing, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) has sanctioned countries and athletes for various reasons, including doping violations and geopolitical conflicts. For instance, Russian athletes competed under the "ROC" designation due to doping sanctions in previous Olympics. Given the ongoing geopolitical tensions and the strict anti-doping regulations in place, it is plausible that some athletes may be barred from competing in the 2024 Paris Olympics. Additionally, individual cases of doping violations or other infractions could lead to athletes being excluded from participation. While the majority of athletes are expected to compete, the likelihood of at least some being barred is significant based on past precedents and current regulatory frameworks.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Inflection Labs would need to demonstrate a commitment to transparency and external evaluation in their public communications or policy statements to make such a report likely. Given the absence of evidence pointing towards this commitment, it is unlikely that Inflection will publish the specified report within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The diplomatic relationship between the Philippines and China has been tense, primarily due to ongoing disputes in the South China Sea. While there have been occasional diplomatic strains, both nations have generally avoided unilateral actions such as expulsions or recalls of diplomats. Historically, even during periods of heightened tension, both countries have sought to manage their disagreements through negotiations and multilateral discussions rather than taking extreme diplomatic measures. Additionally, there have been no recent significant incidents suggesting an imminent escalation to the level of expelling or recalling diplomats within the next few weeks leading up to June 1, 2024. Given these factors, while not impossible, the likelihood of such diplomatic actions occurring in the specified timeframe appears low.

Considering these factors, there is a moderate likelihood of diplomatic expulsions or recalls occurring before June 1, 2025.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there are no indications or events suggesting that Vice President Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States by July 26, 2024. The current President has not signaled any intention to resign, be removed from office, or otherwise vacate the presidency within this timeframe. Additionally, there have been no credible reports or developments pointing towards such a transition. Therefore, absent any unforeseen and unprecedented circumstances, it is highly unlikely that Kamala Harris will assume the presidency by the specified date.
